definition: curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.chinese: 幕間休息時有咖啡可以喝。

sentences.english: The violinist resumed playing after intermission .
sentences.chinese: 幕間休息後，小提琴家繼續演奏。

sentences.english: In between parts of a play, there is often a interval .
sentences.chinese: 在一齣劇的兩部分中間，常有幕間休息。

sentences.english: I like to eat ice cream in the interval.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡在幕間休息時喫冰激凌。

sentences.english: Coffee was served during the intermission.
sentences.chinese: 幕間休息時有咖啡供應。

sentences.english: Local businesses donated items for me to auction off at intermission.
sentences.chinese: 本地企業會送給我一些商品讓我在幕間的時候拍賣。

sentences.english: One of the most crucial parts of any television script is the act break.
sentences.chinese: 電視劇本最重要的部分之一就是幕間。

sentences.english: There are one long interval and two short.
Drinks will be served during the intervals of the three performances.
sentences.chinese: 在三場演出的幕間休息時，有飲料供應。

sentences.english: The violinist resumed playing after the intermission.
sentences.chinese: 幕間休息之後，那小提琴手又重新開始演奏。

sentences.english: The scenes are changed during the intervals.
sentences.chinese: 在幕間休息時場景更換了。

sentences.english: At intermission, he hailed a cab and headed to Madison Avenue.
sentences.chinese: 幕間休息時，他叫了輛出租車匆匆趕往麥迪遜大街。

sentences.english: During the interval, we were taken to the coffee bar.
sentences.chinese: 在幕間休息時，我們被領到咖啡廳。

sentences.english: The husband bought a glass of beer at theatre intermission.
sentences.chinese: 劇院幕間休息時丈夫買了一杯啤酒。
